question: Are male prisoners ten times more likely to self-harm than female prisoners? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Self-harm rates were more than ten times higher in female prisoners than in male inmates.
content.source_2: In models adjusting for age, security category, and sentence length, male inmates exhibited a tenfold higher risk of self-harm than female prisoners over the same period.
content.source_3: FINDINGS 139,195 self-harm incidents were recorded in 26,510 individual prisoners between 2004 and 2009; 5-6% of male prisoners and 20-24% of female inmates self-harmed every year.
content.source_4: Across prisons in England and Wales, the majority of self-harm incidents were recorded among men; this pattern indicates male prisoners were roughly ten times as likely to harm themselves as women.
